recipe_name: Pan fried sea bass with cucumber salsa
method: To make the salsa combine the cucumber, tomato, red onion, chilli, mint and coriander in a bowl. Add the rice vinegar and soya sauce. Season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground pepper. Meanwhile, for the sea bass, heat a large non-stick frying pan. When hot, add the butter and put the fish fillets skin-side down on it. Cook for 2-3 minutes.  Carefully turn the fish fillets and add prawns to the pan. Cook for further 2-3 minutes. Remove from pan. Tip the spring onions and mangetout into the pan used for the fish, cook for 2-3 minutes or until just tender. To serve, divide the salsa between the plates, top with the spring onions and mangetout and place the fish on top skin-side up. Arrange the prawns around the plates and squeeze over a little lime juice.
ingredients: 1 medium cucumber, finely chopped,  2 tomatoes, chopped,  1 red onion, chopped,  Â½ red chilli, finely chopped,  2 tbsp, finely chopped, fresh mint leaves,  2 tbsp, finely chopped, fresh coriander leaves,  2 tbsp rice vinegar,  1 tbsp soy sauce,  25g/1oz unsalted butter,  4 x 175g/6 1/4oz sea bass fillets, skin on,  12 small tiger prawns, peeled and de-veined,  4 small spring onions, left whole,  200g/7oz mangetout,  1 lime, juice only,  Salt and freshly ground pepper
